programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team. Also in HD. [S] Including regional news at 25 and 55 minutes past each hour.
programme.title: Breakfast

programme.desc: 25/25. Series following the work of probate researchers. The team search for living relatives of widower Gordon Smith, who died in 2009, leaving behind an estate worth 150,000 pounds.
programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Lucy Alexander visit a flat on the Isle of Bute, a one-bed property in London and a ground floor flat in Norwich. [S] Then BBC News; Weather.
programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.desc: Clive Holland has help for those who have fallen victim to cowboy builders. The team help two women living near each other who suffered big financial losses thanks to one builder.
programme.title: Cowboy Trap

programme.desc: 10/10. Gloria Hunniford goes back to school for lesson, led by Cambridgeshire Police, revealing the dangers of doorstep crime. Also in HD. [S] Then BBC News; Weather.
programme.title: Doorstep Crime 999

programme.subtitle: Stamford
programme.desc: The antiques challenge comes from Stamford in Lincolnshire, with experts Catherine Southon and Nick Hall. One of the antiques meets an undignified end at auction.
programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.desc: The latest news, sport and weather for the Midlands.

programme.subtitle: Head Screwed On
programme.desc: Zara dreads a duty lunch with her aunt and uncle but is shocked to discover they are not as dull as she thought. Meanwhile, Mandy returns to work. Also in HD. [AD,S]
programme.title: Doctors

programme.subtitle: Suffolk
programme.desc: Property series. Denise Nurse helps a couple find a home with plenty of character in Suffolk. With a budget of 450,000 pounds, the buyers are seeking three bedrooms.
programme.title: Escape to the Country

programme.desc: The latest national and international news stories from the BBC News team, followed by weather.

programme.desc: CBBC. Making of Alaska and South America: Wildlife series. Steve Backshall looks at the challenges faced when filming in the frozen tundra of Alaska and the steaming rainforests of Brazil.

programme.desc: CBBC. Space Disaster: Chantal invites her friend Isabella to be a cadet for a day at Space Program Australia. [S] Then Diddy Dick and Dom.
programme.title: Prank Patrol Down Under

programme.desc: CBBC. Sam and Mark host as two families battle it out in a range of hilarious games, like Quick on the Draw, Mime Time, Music Round, and the formidable Copycats Challenge. Also in HD.
programme.title: Copycats

programme.desc: CBBC. Helen and Barney show you how you can upcycle odd gloves left over from winter into fabulous new toys and Kieron Richardson reveals his favourite children's book. Also in HD.
programme.title: Blue Peter

programme.desc: CBBC. Topical news magazine for children.

programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score as few points as possible by plumbing the depths of their general knowledge to come up with the answers no-one else can think of.

programme.desc: Matt Baker and Chris Evans bring you the stories that matter from across the country. Also in HD.

programme.desc: A compilation of the best bits from the sports quiz. Regulars Sue Barker, Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell are joined by guests including Michael Owen. Also in HD. [S] Then BBC News.

programme.desc: Phil is furious when Jay and Ben confess the truth about their recent actions, and points out that things could soon be over for them all as a result. Also in HD. [AD,S]
programme.title: EastEnders

programme.desc: 3/9. Rob Brydon hosts the comedy panel show, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack, and guest panelists David O'Doherty, Katherine Parkinson, Bill Turnbull and Louie Spence. Also in HD.

programme.desc: 6/10. Objects of Desire: Drama. A murder investigation reunites DSI Sandra Pullman with an old flame, DCI James Larson. Meanwhile, Brian Lane faces a domestic crisis. [AD,S]

programme.desc: ...Night Draws. The National Lottery Friday night draws presented by Scott Mills. Includes Thunderball, EuroMillions and the UK Millionaire Raffle, with a guaranteed prize of a million pounds.
programme.title: The National Lottery Friday...

programme.desc: 5/6. They Think It's All Over: Ollie can't celebrate his birthday when he is dropped from his football team. Contains adult humour. Also in HD.

programme.desc: Masood is stunned when his wayward brother AJ arrives on the Square, but it soon becomes clear why Zainab is not a fan. Kat's efforts to spend time alone with Alfie are thwarted. Also in HD. [AD,S]

programme.desc: Detailed weather forecast.

programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news, with bulletins on the hour and the headlines every 15 minutes.
